fr.xephi.authme.service

Class BukkitService

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.xephi.authme.service.BukkitService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SettingsDependent

    public class BukkitService
extends Object
implements SettingsDependent
    Service for operations requiring the Bukkit API, such as for scheduling.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int TICKS_PER_MINUTE
      Number of ticks per minute.
      static int TICKS_PER_SECOND
      Number of ticks per second in the Bukkit main thread.

    • Method Detail

      • scheduleSyncDelayedTask

        public int scheduleSyncDelayedTask(Runnable task)
        Schedules a once off task to occur as soon as possible.

        This task will be executed by the main server thread.

        Parameters:
        task - Task to be executed
        Returns:
        Task id number (-1 if scheduling failed)

      • scheduleSyncDelayedTask

        public int scheduleSyncDelayedTask(Runnable task,
                                   long delay)
        Schedules a once off task to occur after a delay.

        This task will be executed by the main server thread.

        Parameters:
        task - Task to be executed
        delay - Delay in server ticks before executing task
        Returns:
        Task id number (-1 if scheduling failed)

      • scheduleSyncTaskFromOptionallyAsyncTask

        public void scheduleSyncTaskFromOptionallyAsyncTask(Runnable task)
        Schedules a synchronous task if we are currently on a async thread; if not, it runs the task immediately. Use this when optionally asynchronous tasks have to run something synchronously.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to be run

      • runTask

        public org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitTask runTask(Runnable task)
        Returns a task that will run on the next server tick.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to be run
        Returns:
        a BukkitTask that contains the id number
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if task is null

                                                    long delay)
        Returns a task that will run after the specified number of server ticks.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to be run
        delay - the ticks to wait before running the task
        Returns:
        a BukkitTask that contains the id number
        Throws:

      • runTaskOptionallyAsync

        public void runTaskOptionallyAsync(Runnable task)
        Schedules this task to run asynchronously or immediately executes it based on AuthMe's configuration.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to run

      • runTaskAsynchronously

        public org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitTask runTaskAsynchronously(Runnable task)
        Asynchronous tasks should never access any API in Bukkit. Great care should be taken to assure the thread-safety of asynchronous tasks.

        Returns a task that will run asynchronously.

        Parameters:
        task - the task to be run
        Returns:
        a BukkitTask that contains the id number
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if task is null

      • runTaskTimerAsynchronously

        public org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitTask runTaskTimerAsynchronously(Runnable task,
                                                                  long delay,
                                                                  long period)
        Asynchronous tasks should never access any API in Bukkit. Great care should be taken to assure the thread-safety of asynchronous tasks.

        Returns a task that will repeatedly run asynchronously until cancelled, starting after the specified number of server ticks.

        Parameters:
        task - the task to be run
        delay - the ticks to wait before running the task for the first time
        period - the ticks to wait between runs
        Returns:
        a BukkitTask that contains the id number
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if task is null

      • runTaskTimer

        public org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitTask runTaskTimer(org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitRunnable task,
                                                    long delay,
                                                    long period)
        Schedules the given task to repeatedly run until cancelled, starting after the specified number of server ticks.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to schedule
        delay - the ticks to wait before running the task
        period - the ticks to wait between runs
        Returns:
        a BukkitTask that contains the id number
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
        IllegalStateException - if this was already scheduled
        See Also:
        BukkitScheduler.runTaskTimer(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin, Runnable, long, long)

        Returns:

      • getOfflinePlayer

        public org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer getOfflinePlayer(String name)
        Gets the player by the given name, regardless if they are offline or online.

        This method may involve a blocking web request to get the UUID for the given name.

        This will return an object even if the player does not exist. To this method, all players will exist.

        Parameters:
        name - the name the player to retrieve
        Returns:
        an offline player

      • getBannedPlayers

        public Set<org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer> getBannedPlayers()
        Gets a set containing all banned players.
        Returns:
        a set containing banned players

      • getOfflinePlayers

        public org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer[] getOfflinePlayers()
        Gets every player that has ever played on this server.
        Returns:
        an array containing all previous players

      • getOnlinePlayers

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • sendBungeeMessage

      • banIp

        public org.bukkit.BanEntry banIp(String ip,
                                 String reason,
                                 Date expires,
                                 String source)
        Adds a ban to the this list. If a previous ban exists, this will update the previous entry.
        Parameters:
        ip - the ip of the ban
        reason - reason for the ban, null indicates implementation default
        expires - date for the ban's expiration (unban), or null to imply forever
        source - source of the ban, null indicates implementation default
        Returns:
        the entry for the newly created ban, or the entry for the (updated) previous ban

      • isBungeeCordConfiguredForSpigot

        public Optional<Boolean> isBungeeCordConfiguredForSpigot()
        Returns an optional with a boolean indicating whether bungeecord is enabled or not if the server implementation is Spigot. Otherwise returns an empty optional.
        Returns:
        Optional with configuration value for Spigot, empty optional otherwise

      • getIp

        public String getIp()
        Returns:
        the IP string that this server is bound to, otherwise empty string
